name: Hebridean Cycle Challenge
description: The Hebridean Cycle Challenge is a competitive road and mountain bike race with the option of running the off-road section instead of cycling it. The Challenge begins with a 33.6 mile road cycle from the Creed Enterprise Park outside Stornoway to Miavaig in North Harris. The race then continues with a 10.5 mile off road section through the mountains from Miavaig to Bowglas and ends with a 0.9 mile road section to the finish at the Scaladale Centre, Ardvourlie, North Harris. Competitors can enter the Hebridean Cycle Challenge as soloists or as teams of two with the changeover point in the team event being at the start of the off-road section at Miavaig. Also on the day there is The Hebridean Charity Cycle a non competitive 21 mile event catering for casual cyclists as well as The Hebridean Charity Walk, a 12k,non-competitive walk following the ancient route through the Harris hills . This year's charity is the Andrew Macleod Memorial Fund which supports local heart screening events.
organizer: Lewis and Harris Youth Clubs Association

name: Big South East Aquathlon
description: Come and swim in one of the cleanest lakes in Kent. Just a few minutes from the M25 in Dartford

name: VeloPark Trent Park Mince Pie's Revenge Duathlon
description: The event takes place on the magnificent closed road circuit surrounding the 2012 Olympic velodrome in the Velopark, Stratford.The purpose built circuit is 1mile in length.The event format of run-bike-run, starts with with a 2mile (2 lap) first run then a 10mile (10 lap) bike section before finishing with a 1mile (1 lap) final run.The event is chip timed with medals for the places in 16-19years, 20-39years, 40-49years and 50+years age bands.The event is open to all ability levels and is both an ideal venue for your first duathlon whilst at the same time provides a challenge for the more experienced duathletes and triathletes.There are changing and showering facilities as well as cafes on site. Providing the backdrop to the event is the London Aquatic Centre (used for the 2012 Olympic swimming events), the 2012 athletics Stadium and the ArcelorMittal Orbit and the vast Westfield shopping centre.

name: Francis Clark Taunton Deane Aquathlon
description: a pool based swim + run race for over 14 yrs. with two distance options 500m/5km or 1km/10km (over 16 only). team entries also accepted.

location.name: wellington sports centre, corams lane. wellington, somerset

name: GO TRI Alnwick - Ladies Only Tri
description: A very informal Ladies only event based in doors designed for women to try a tri.200m swim in the pool, 5km on the gym bike, 2km run on the treadmillStarting at 7pm for first athletes in the water. Between the swim and going up to the gym, there is time to get changed as the transitions are not timed.The event is kept very small with a maximum of 16 people to ensure a safe, friendly environment.

name: INTRtri St Davids Aquathlon
description: This event is set up to encourage Novices to participate in multi sports events alongside age groupers

name: Macclesfield Forest Off Road Duathlon
description: An Off Road Duathlon in Macclesfield Forest and taking in Shuttlingsloe for the first run stage.The event will comprise:Run 1 - 7km (including 365m ascent to the summit of Shuttlingsloe)Mountain Bike - 18km (Three lap course within Macclesfield Forest with approximately 250m of climb per lap)Run 2 - 3.4km (including 222m of ascent within Macclesfield Forest)The race venue is Trentabank Visitors Centre, Macclesfield Forest, Near Macclesfield, SK11 0NE - there will be toilets, refreshments and parking at or near the Visitors Centre.

name: Frosty Aquathlon
description: 2016 sees the 21st staging of the Frosty - 2 Aquathlons where the swim is indoors in a 25m pool, and then a run around the local boating lake and along the seafront promenade. The course is flat and provided the weather is calm fast times can be achieved. The longer Frosty has a team race of four including at least one female. Competitors enter and race separately, but the times combine for the overall team result. Frostbite, first race off at 7am

name: Bedford Super Sprint 1 *Rescheduled*
description: **EVENT RESCHEDULED TO 31st JULY 2016**The Bedford Super Sprint Triathlon Series has been on the calendar since 2004 and has attracted a whole spectrum of competitors from complete novices - who see just the 400m swim a challenge - right up to national champions.The format is simple - identical races spanning the season. The man and woman with the shortest total time at the end are the winners.Each race is based at Robinson Pool in Bedford. The race consists of a 400m swim followed by a 24km bike around the villages north of Bedford and finishes with a 5km run around the picturesque Bedford Park.

name: Bedford Super Sprint 3
description: The Bedford Super Sprint Triathlon Series has been on the calendar since 2004 and has attracted a whole spectrum of competitors from complete novices - who see just the 400m swim a challenge - right up to national champions.The format is simple - identical races spanning the season. The man and woman with the shortest total time at the end are the winners.Each race is based at Robinson Pool in Bedford. The race consists of a 400m swim followed by a 24km bike around the villages north of Bedford and finishes with a 5km run around the picturesque Bedford Park.

name: Tewkesbury Aquathlon Series Race 1
description: Aquathlon Series 4 pre season events - swim 400 m and run 5 k January - to April 2016

name: GO TRI Ulverston Tri Club Winter Duathlon Series Race 4
description: Off road Duathlon:5km off road Run 11km off road Bike 5km off road Run

name: Mad March for Adults & Children 8+
description: A great early season event for the whole family to enjoy. The Swim in a School pool. The Adult Cycle & Run Route takes in some of the Dorset countryside, whilst the Junior Event is all held on the school field.

name: Ringwood Triathlon
description: A great early season tester - 600m pool swim, 28mile bike, 5mile run

name: Swanage Bay Triathlon
description: 750m Sea Swim, 20km Bike & 5km Run. Quite possibly my favourite event with the swim in Swanage Bay, the cycle route taking in amazing views of Corfe Castle and the Dorset Coast. The run route passes by the famous Swanage Steam Train station.

name: Dale Care Off Road Duathlon
description: Start Time: 11amMinimum Age: 15 (based on the age as at the 31st December in the current year)Distances: 5.5km Run, 13km Mountain Bike and 4.4km RunOverview:  Kick start the 2016 season with a bit of off road.  Hamsterley Forest is one of the Northeast’s premier mountain bike destinations. Explore the largest forest in County Durham on foot and bike as you take on this exciting new challenge.  Starting at Bedburn Beck Car Park, near to the visitors centre, the course consists of 5.5km Off Road Trail Run, 13km Mountain Bike Ride taking in some of the famous black and red routes, followed by a 4.4km Run.Prizes:  Prizes will be awarded to the first 3 males and females in the following categories; junior, senior and veteran. Prizes have been kindly donated by our event sponsor Dale Care Ltd. Dale Care is one of the leading County Durham home care services, who are passionate about providing exceptional local home care.

name: Black Country Triathletes Junior Aquathlon
description: Junior aquathlon for ages 8 to 16

name: Black Country Triathletes Junior Duathlon
description: Junior duathlon for ages 8 - 16

name: Tewkesbury Aquathlon Series Race 3
description: Aquathlon Series 4 pre season events - swim 400 m and run 5 k January - to April 2016

name: Tewkesbury Aquathlon Series Race 2
description: Aquathlon Series 4 pre season events - swim 400 m and run 5 k January - to April 2016

name: GO TRI - Hadleigh Park Winter Series Event 8
description: An 8 event series running fortnightly from October to January 2016 for any ability. Come give it a Tri!Event is FREE! (Parking charges still apply)Turn up on the day. No need to book in advance. Sign-on from 8:30am, closes at 9:30am. Race start 10:00amYou will require a mountain bike and helmet in good order.

name: GO TRI - Hadleigh Park Winter Series Event 7
description: An 8 event series running fortnightly from October to January 2016 for any ability. Come give it a Tri!Event is FREE! (Parking charges still apply)Turn up on the day. No need to book in advance. Sign-on from 8:30am, closes at 9:30am. Race start 10:00am. You will require a mountain bike and helmet in good order.

name: Bala Standard Distance Triathlon
description: The Bala Standard Distance Triathlon is located in the market town of Bala, Gwynedd, North Wales, and is situated in South Snowdonia on the shores of Llyn Tegid the largest fresh water lake in Wales. The Middle Distance Triathlon takes place in and around the lakeside town. Llyn Tegid is 4 miles (6.4k) long and 0.75 miles (1.3k) wide. It is owned and managed by the Snowdonia National Park Authority and is without question one of the most scenic Triathlons in the country.The Standard Distance Triathlon will consist of a:1500m Swim39 km Cycle10k Run.

name: VeloPark East London Triathletes Winter Warmer Duathlon
description: The event takes place on the magnificent closed road circuit surrounding the 2012 Olympic velodrome in the Velopark, Stratford.The purpose built circuit is 1mile in length.The event format of run-bike-run, starts with with a 2mile (2 lap) first run then a 10mile (10 lap) bike section before finishing with a 1mile (1 lap) final run.The event is chip timed with medals for the places in 16-19years, 20-39years, 40-49years and 50+years age bands.The event is open to all ability levels and is both an ideal venue for your first duathlon whilst at the same time provides a challenge for the more experienced duathletes and triathletes.There are changing and showering facilities as well as cafes on site. Providing the backdrop to the event is the London Aquatic Centre (used for the 2012 Olympic swimming events), the 2012 athletics Stadium and the ArcelorMittal Orbit and the vast Westfield shopping centre.

name: East Grinstead Spring Aquathlon
description: A small and friendly Aquathlon suitable for people of all abilities. The 500m swim is in the 25 metre pool at the Kings Centre, East Grinstead and the 5km run takes in the historic town centre.

name: East Grinstead Autumn Aquathlon
description: A small and friendly Aquathlon suitable for people of all abilities. The 500m swim is in the 25 meter pool at the Kings Centre, East Grinstead and the 5km run takes in the historic town centre.

name: Sun City Duathlon
description: A mouth-watering way to start the season.  A straight up Run, Bike, Run - 5k, 20k, 5k taking in the superb coastal road of Seaburn, a fast and fantastic 4 lap bike course, bookended with a picturesque run through park, promenade and parade.Visit our website and see last year's video, maps and see what top athletes had to say.Also take our virtual video tour of the course.Being on the newly developed seafront there are loads of good vantage points, with seats for spectators. There's a local crowd and plenty for family and friends to do after the race. Apart from the above, you will get access to the Seaburn Centre which will have some refreshments, a meet n greet hall with room for all to chat away those nerves and keep warm. It also has ample toilet facilities.There will be a souvenir video available for high res download to show off, and you will also get a simple link to share on your Facebook, twitter etc. So everyone can see what you achieved!! Ideal

name: Mud and Mayhem Duathlon
description: Duathlon Cross; Full course: Run 5k Bike 18k Run 5k.

location.name: St. Helen's picnic site, Santon Downham, Thetford Forest

organizer: Go Beyond Challenge Ltd T/A Go Beyond Sport

name: Pitsford Triathlon Sprint Distance
description: An Open Water Sprint Distance Triathlon based at Pitsford Reservoir and utilising the superb facilities of Northampton Sailing Club.Fantastic swim facilities, a terrific bike course on some of the best cycling roads in the county and a run course that takes in the picturesque lake trails provides all the ingredients for a special event.
organizer: Go Beyond Challenge Ltd T/A Go Beyond Sport

name: Pitsford Triathlon
description: Standard Distance Triathlon, single laps for swim, bike and run
organizer: Go Beyond Challenge Ltd T/A Go Beyond Sport

name: Avon Aquathlon
description: The event is run by Stonehenge Triathlon and Road Club, with support from Green Coaching. The race consists of a 500m pool swim followed by a fast 5km run on a mix of trails and road, on Salisbury Plain. Suitable for all levels of competitor, particularly good for novices who wish to try their first multi-sport event, or seasoned athletes who want an early season blow out!

name: BCT Adult Spring Aquathlon
description: Adult aquathlon to run prior to junior aquathlon

name: Dinton Kids Duathlon
description: A great way to start the Easter weekend and burn off that chocolate before you eat it!Back for the second year due to popular demand....at Dinton Pastures Country Park. Off-road running and cycling around the disused golf course. All children always in sight of a marshal.Medal and goody bag for every finisher.

name: Dinton Kids Tri
description: Back for the second year - kids triathlon at Dinton Pastures Country Park with an Open Water Swim in Black Swan Lake and off-road cycle and run around the disused Golf Course. Open for all children aged 8 - 14 years.

name: GO TRI Velo Park Duathlon
description: A duathlon in the Velo Park in Queen Elizabeth II park in Stratford - home of the London 2012 Olympic Games.

name: Teme Leisure Aquathlon
description: 400m Swim - 10k Run. The inaugural Teme Leisure Aquathlon will take place on Sunday 21st February. Competitors will face a 400m indoor pool swim followed by a scenic 10k run (majority on tarmac) through the rolling countryside of South Shropshire through the shadows of Ludlow Castle and finishing within the grounds of the Leisure Centre.

name: GO TRI Velo Park Duathlon
description: A duathlon in the Velo Park in Queen Elizabeth II park in Stratford - home of the London 2012 Olympic Games.

name: Great Northern Trail Triathlon 2016
description: A triathlon that provides a great introduction to the sport for beginners, whislt at the same time offering a challenge to more experienced participants. The swimming takes place in a small community pool with reduced numbers, so great for inexperienced swimmers. The cycle is challenging with significant elements off-road, but on tarmac with a great out and back run.

name: Ribby Hall Triathlon
description: Flat, fast SPRINT triathlon on quiet country lanes and around the Ribby Hall Leisure Village.  Now in its 6th year and part of the Fylde Trilogy Series including St Annes and Fleetwood. Ideal for first timers or those wanting an early season PB. Medals, gifts, chip timing, prizes all included in one of the lowest cost triathlons in the UK.

name: St Annes Triathlon
description: CLOSED ROADS flat, fast SPRINT triathlon on quiet country lanes and around the St Annes Promenade.  Now in its 9th year and part of the Fylde Trilogy Series including Ribby Hall and Fleetwood. Ideal for first timers or those wanting an early season PB. Medals, gifts, chip timing, prizes all included in one of the lowest cost triathlons in the UK. Open to adults and all children (tristar) age groups, allowing them to race on proper closed roads!

name: Fleetwood Triathlon
description: CLOSED ROADS flat, fast SPRINT triathlon on quiet country lanes and around the Fleetwood Promenade.  Now in its 8th year and part of the Fylde Trilogy Series including Ribby Hall and St Annes. Ideal for first timers or those wanting an early season PB. Medals, gifts, chip timing, prizes all included in one of the lowest cost triathlons in the UK. Open to adults and all children (tristar) age groups, allowing them to race on proper closed roads!

name: Pwllheli Triathlon 2016
description: Sprint distance Pool Triathlon (route etc the same as event in 2014/15.

name: Hole Park MTB Duathlon
description: Returning for the 3rd year Hole Park MTB Duathlon will take place at Hole Park, Nr Rolvenden, Cranbrook, Kent on Sunday 29th March 2015 starting at 9am.With three different events to choose from Hole Park MTB Duathlons will be held within the picturesque award-winning gardens and grounds of Hole Park with views of the Weald of Kent and as fair reaching as Hastings. The run section takes in views of Hole Park orchards, while the MTB section passes through fords, crosses bridges and over fields with some testing sections to spark up the fun. This event is ideal for everyone from the beginner MTB duathlete to proven professionals.Facilities available for competitors are changing areas, on-site tearoom with home-baked food using fresh local produce, chip timing, onsite bike mechanic, bike wash area, on-site camping (additional fee), toilets, goody bags, event t-shirt, medal and prizes. Free entry for all to browse Hole Park gardens and free parking.

name: Diss Duathlon
description: The Tri-Anglia Triathlon club is pleased to present the Diss Duathlon, which comprises a 5k run, 30k bike and a second 5k run. The run course follows a route through part of the attractive town centre and the bike course is rural, reasonably flat(ish), and has little traffic.

name: Tri Team Glos 4th Newent April Duathlon
description: The 2016 TTG Newent Duathlon is a Sprint Duathlon for all ages (entrants must be 15 and over on race day). 5km run through Newent (x 2) The Cycle route is 18km through picturesque countryside encouraging fast times.Registration commences at 08.00, Transition will also be open from 08.00 with the men's race commencing at 10.00 with the ladies starting 10 minutes later.

name: Ambleside Duathlon Dash
description: Standard, Sprint and Novice Duathlon Event around Lake Windermere and Ambleside.

name: GO TRI Sri Chinmoy Tri Club's Duathlon at Tockington Manor #1
description: Ideal for triathletes who want multisport practice, or anyone who wants the challenge of combining two sports.

name: GO TRI Sri Chinmoy Swim-Run at Filton Pool
description: Our Swim-Run event is part of the GO TRI series, organised in partnership between the Sri Chinmoy Tri Club (Bristol) and Triathlon England. The 200M swim takes place in Filton Leisure Centre's heated, 25M pool and the 3KM run is a loop course around Elm Park.Like all GO TRI events, the Sri Chinmoy Filton Swim Run is beginner-friendly - you can swim any stroke to complete the 8-length (200m) swim and the run is nearly flat and on a mix of pavement and grass.An ideal stepping stone towards your first triathlon or a fun multi-sport race in its own right.
